news_header: Three former Harrods employees accuse Ali Fayed of sexual assault during the 1990s, with allegations of abuse by his brother Mohamed Al Fayed as well.
news_original_title: 'His hands were everywhere' - women accuse surviving Fayed brother of sexual assault
news_text: Three women, former employees of Harrods, have publicly accused Ali Fayed of sexual assault during the 1990s when he was working with his brothers, Mohamed and Salah, who owned the department store. They claim that the assaults occurred in various locations, including London and the US. Ali Fayed denies the allegations, stating they are untrue and that he will defend himself against them. The women also allege prior abuse by Mohamed Al Fayed, with one woman expressing a desire for understanding and healing. The accusations have led to discussions about the broader culture of abuse within the Fayed family.
